alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 9:29AM AKST until February 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches are expected. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range. * WHEN...Until 6 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 55 mph north of Trims Camp will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow over Richardson Highway Summits. Heaviest snow amounts expected from Trims Camp south. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
